posts.post_content:
Dev1: But we want to bring back [Necropotence](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Necropotence)'s card drawing engine. But what kind of body should we put it on so it won't be broken?

Posted By: Lord_of_phyrexia (7/26/2013 7:47:36 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
[Liliana of the Veil](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Liliana of the Veil): Yo Mikaeus, wake up! Where's [Griselbrand](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name= Griselbrand)?  
  
[Mikaeus, The Unhallowed](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mikaeus, The Unhallowed): Brains?  
  
Liliana: Mik, seriously!  
  
Mikaeus: BRAINS!  
  
Liliana: Dammit, Mik!  
  
Mikaeus: Guuuuaahhhchhhhh....  
  
Liliana: Screw this. When I'm done with that demon, I'm going to cut out Geralf's heart with his own letter opener.  
  
Mikaeus: Geralf brains?  
  
Liliana: \*Sighs\* sure. You can eat his brain. Now where's Griselbrand?  
  
Mikaeus: [Helvault](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Helvault).  
  
Liliana: Great. How do I get him out?  
  
Mikaeus: ....   
  
Liliana: Not even Garruk is as dense as you. Thanks for nothing.  
  
Mikaeus: Brains.

Posted By: Smoke_Stack (2/9/2013 10:00:00 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Incredible card. Timmy sees a 7/7 with flying & lifelink. Johnny sees a nice toy for [Liliana](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Liliana) & [Unburial Rites](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Unburial Rites). Spike sees a [Yawgmoth's Bargain](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Yawgmoth's Bargain) with lifelink that doubles as a finisher.   
  
So many synergies, so little time.  
  
**Block**: [Unburial Rites](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Unburial Rites)  
**Standard**: [Unburial Rites](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Unburial Rites)  
**Extended**: [Fauna Shaman](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Fauna Shaman) with [Necrotic Ooze](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Necrotic Ooze)  
**Modern**: [Goryo's Vengeance](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Goryo's Vengeance)  
**Legacy**: [Dread Return](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Dread Return), [Exhume](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Exhume), [Animate Dead](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Animate Dead), [Show and Tell](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Show and Tell)  
**Vintage**: [Oath of Druids](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Oath of Druids), [Necromancy](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Necromancy), [Dance of the Dead](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Dance of the Dead)
posts.html:
Incredible card. Timmy sees a 7/7 with flying & lifelink. Johnny sees a nice toy for Liliana & Unburial Rites. Spike sees a Yawgmoth's Bargain with lifelink that doubles as a finisher.

So many synergies, so little time.

Block: Unburial Rites
Standard: Unburial Rites
Extended: Fauna Shaman with Necrotic Ooze
Modern: Goryo's Vengeance
Legacy: Dread Return, Exhume, Animate Dead, Show and Tell
Vintage: Oath of Druids, Necromancy, Dance of the Dead
Report Abuse  
Posted By: YawgmothsWish (4/30/2012 4:04:19 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: Paying life to draw cards has already proven to be broken (see [Necropotence](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Necropotence)). With that card, you get them at the end of your turn. This one is an on demand draw engine, with lifelink and flying and a good body. And with all of the shenanigans black has to avoid paying for creatures, you probably won't need to hard cast it. 5/5
posts.html:
Paying life to draw cards has already proven to be broken (see Necropotence). With that card, you get them at the end of your turn. This one is an on demand draw engine, with lifelink and flying and a good body. And with all of the shenanigans black has to avoid paying for creatures, you probably won't need to hard cast it. 5/5

posts.post_content:
Griselbrand got himself grisel-banned.  
  
What fun we had in EDH while it lasted. I shall always remember drawing half my library and winning on the spot.  
Good night, sweet prince, and may a pack of devils sing thee to thy rest.

Posted By: Continue (7/24/2013 5:25:16 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
I traded for one of these guys the day before he was banned in commander, so I'd never gotten a chance to play with him.  
After months of him sitting in my binder, I decided to test him out in a deck I was making. And hot damn.  
What a BAMF  
It's pretty nice always having a full hand, especially whilst beating the hell out of your opponent.  
5/5

Posted By: Raexs (7/21/2013 10:40:20 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
This is the most powerful demon in the current standard format. If you do play either with or against him remember that despite there being three 7s in his text, his casting cost is actually eight.  
  
I want to make a [Shadowborn Apostle](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Shadowborn Apostle) deck with a few of this guy, [Sign in Blood](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Sign in Blood), and [Immortal Servitude](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Immortal Servitude).  
  
5/5 for the power and the flavor.
posts.html:
This is the most powerful demon in the current standard format. If you do play either with or against him remember that despite there being three 7s in his text, his casting cost is actually eight.

I want to make a Shadowborn Apostle deck with a few of this guy, Sign in Blood, and Immortal Servitude.

5/5 for the power and the flavor.

posts.post_content:
Pro Turn 1 at a local Vintage Tournament (on the play):  
-[Bazaar of Baghdad](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Bazaar of Baghdad), [Lion's Eye Diamond](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Lion's Eye Diamond)  
-Tap Bazaar, Draw 2, Discard [Golgari Grave-Troll](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Golgari Grave-Troll), [Bridge from Below](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Bridge from Below), [Dread Return](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Dread Return)  
-Cycle [Street Wraith](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Street Wraith), Dredge Grave Troll, milling Bridge from Below, 2x [Narcomoeba](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Narcomoeba), [Stinkweed Imp](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name= Stinkweed Imp), [Cabal Therapy](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Cabal Therapy), [Griselbrand](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Griselbrand)  
-Narcs hit play, sac 1 to cast Therapy, naming [Force of Will](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Force of Will) (therapy whiffs), putting 2 zombies into play from Bridge  
-Sac narc and 2 zombies for dread return targeting griselbrand, put 2 zombies into play from bridge  
-pitch hand to lion's eye diamond  
-Activate griselbrand, dredge (over 7 individual draws) for a total of 34 cards, hitting the remaining 2 narcomoebas and a 3rd bridge.  
-Sac 2 narcs and a zombie, dread return [laboratory maniac/autocard](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=laboratory maniac/autocard)... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)
posts.html:
Pro Turn 1 at a local Vintage Tournament (on the play):
-Bazaar of Baghdad, Lion's Eye Diamond
-Tap Bazaar, Draw 2, Discard Golgari Grave-Troll, Bridge from Below, Dread Return
-Cycle Street Wraith, Dredge Grave Troll, milling Bridge from Below, 2x Narcomoeba, Stinkweed Imp, Cabal Therapy, Griselbrand
-Narcs hit play, sac 1 to cast Therapy, naming Force of Will (therapy whiffs), putting 2 zombies into play from Bridge
-Sac narc and 2 zombies for dread return targeting griselbrand, put 2 zombies into play from bridge
-pitch hand to lion's eye diamond
-Activate griselbrand, dredge (over 7 individual draws) for a total of 34 cards, hitting the remaining 2 narcomoebas and a 3rd bridge.
-Sac 2 narcs and a zombie, dread return laboratory maniac/autocard... (see all)
